rooms.Name: The Chat Room
rooms.Description:
A small and cozy chamber is light by a candles and a fire that burns warmly
in the marble fireplace.  A statue of a cat stands upon the hearth, the light
reflecting off of its glossy surface.  Two comfortable chairs stand in front
of the fire, upholstered in a soft, dark green velvet.  A thick carpet of 
midknight blue with a dark-green leaf pattern covers most of the floor and
invites you to wiggle your toes in its softness. The floral bouquet which 
stands on a long table fills the air wonderfully withs its fragrance.

rooms.Name: The TIME OUT room.
rooms.Description:
You have been put in this room to take time out and figure out
exactly why you were put in this room.  Please consider all the
things you have been doing in the last few minutes.  In a
few minutes, an Immortal will be with you.  Please treat this
immortal with the respect due an immortal because remember, the
ice box is only a step away.

THIS is your warning.

rooms.Name: The Ice Box
rooms.Description:
Here lie the frozen remains of mud players who just couldn't learn to
play nicely with the other kids in the sandbox.  Let this be a frigid
reminder to you that the eyes above are watching, ready to cast you into
the frozen wastelands without so much as a warning should you transgress.

rooms.Name: Reimbursement Room
rooms.Description:
You have been magically summoned here to the Ashes to Ashes
Reimbursement Room. Please be patient and explain problems fully.
The staff reserves the right to refuse any and all replacements for good
reason. As well, items may change over time, so please understand that.

rooms.Name: The Board Room of the Immortals
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a spacious, airy room. It is brightly lit, but you fail
to see any visible light sources. The floor is made of marble, with squares
of black-streaked and pure white marble set in a complex pattern which you
are constantly on the verge of grasping. The walls of this room are pure
white, and are set with many large, floor-length windows which give a
magnificent view of all the mortal realms. There are several sitting areas
set up throughout the room, where sofas and chairs upholstered in shades of
emerald and rose are clustered together to form comfortable nooks, seemingly
isolated from the rest of the room. In the center of the room stands a large
table, surrounded by innumerable chairs, where Immortals may meet to discuss
their not doing anything about the MUD. Set in a place of honor on one of
the walls is a large board, set within an intricately sculpted frame of pure
gold. Perhaps you ought to take the time to read what is written upon it.

Exits.Description:
A large, yet somehow obscure, door set in the southwestern corner of
this room leads off to an airy, well lit lounge for off-duty crew.

rooms.Name: The Lower Board Room of the Immortals
rooms.Description:
This room is very similar to the room above.  It has the same patterned
marble floor, the same emerald and rose color scheme, and it too
has the large, floor-length windows.  However, this room comes
across as being much more informal than the room above.  The furniture
is arranged in casual groupings which look like they change quite 
often.  Music is playing softly in the background, and there is a bar
over in the corner where you can grab a glass of your favorite brew
and kick back and relax.  In one corner of the room there is an elegant
marble stairway which winds it's way down to the Temple of Midgaard.
But why bother going down there when you can hang out up here?

Exits.Description:
A well screened inter-dimensional portal hangs quietly in the air here.  You
have no idea where it could possibly lead...
You see the main Immortal Board Room at the top of the spiral staircase

rooms.Name: The Quest Chamber
rooms.Description:
With notepads, sheets of paper, and computer printouts going a mile a minute,
you can see that the place is a disaster area.  Every now and then you see
someone come by to read a printout, scratch his head, and grumble to himself.
Looking around you see pictures from past quests and ideas of quests yet to
come.  Perhaps yours will be done soon.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The bulletin board is here for you to place your ideason. Be our guest and
use it freely. Signed, The Questmasters of Ashes to Ashes.

rooms.Name: The Upper Board Room of the Immortals
rooms.Description:
This room is quite large, but it is very dark and has a musty smell.
The paint on the walls is cracked a bit, and there are spider webs
festooned across the ceiling.  It looks as though this room has been
abandoned for some time, and you get the feeling that even in it's
prime, this room didn't see much action.  Perhaps this room serves
best as a monument to a good idea taken a bit too far.

rooms.Name: A quiet lounge for off-duty construction crew
rooms.Description:
Spare steel beams and transparent plate glass walls help to give this lounge
an airy, open feel by letting in large quantities of bright, ambient light!
A low iron railing frames a square window cut into the center of the floor,
around which are clustered comfortable sofas and coffee tables. Looking over
the railings gives one a breathtakingly beautiful view of the world below.

rooms.Name: The River Phoenix
rooms.Description:
"HEY!! What are you doing in here? At least let me get my feathers
on before you barge in like that.. (tum tee tum).  Okay, how do I
look?  FABULOUS!! Have a seat!"

You see a giant feather bed (few ashes on there never hurt anyone)
in one corner and a fire extinguisher right beside it.  (When Phoenix
rises.. you can bet that little darlin' will come in mighty handy!)

"Thanks for stoping by.. and uh, call first next time, huh?
Love ya Buh-Bye now!"

Phoenix waves happily.

rooms.Name: Asita's Lair
rooms.Description:
Misty waters of the winedark sea thunder against the white stone plateaus
that reach up through the clouds.  These plateaus are filled with warm sky
blue water and line the entrance to a cave.  Inside this cave that is
surrounded by pools of water are many elaborate rugs, and plush skins for
lounging.  At night, when the sky grows dark, the lair walls illuminate with
the galaxy beyond.

rooms.Name: The Cimp+ Hangout
rooms.Description:
You see a large mirror, reflecting your face with a toothy grin.
Much prettier than ascii.

rooms.Name: Kaitlin's Hideaway
rooms.Description:
You have entered a quiet, secluded cottage in the forest.  A warm, inviting
fire burns in the hearth to welcome home the occupants of this place. The
drapes move softly as a fresh breeze blows in off the sparkling clear waters
of the lake outside.  The comfiness of this place makes you want to stay and
visit so make yourself at home.

rooms.Name: The coding announcement room
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in a vast room filled with all kinds of junk.  You
see numerous computers, stacks of books on various programming languages,
miles of printouts, and a lot of coffee machines, Mountain Dew bottles and 
pizza boxes.
There are several people bent over keyboards typing frantically,
trying to improve the mud code.  Occasionally one of them curses and
slams his or her fist on the keyboard in frustration.

rooms.Name: Backstage at the Alanis Morissette Concert
rooms.Description:
As you materialize, you suddenly come to the realization that you have not
only been summoned, but that your soul has been plucked out of its mortal
coil and has been deposited here, in what appears to be a dressing room
backstage at a huge concert hall. You are slowly bathed in soothing white
light. You shield your eyes from the glow, and can barely make out a mighty
throne, engraved along the top with the words, "Smokin' HoT!" The smell of
fresh oranges overwhelms you, and, if you listen closely, the sounds of
Vivaldi wafting from this bright room reach out and touch your heart. All at
once, the sense of despair you first felt is dispelled, and you feel as
though you could stay forever. A bright yellow lava lamp glows silently in
the corner. There is a huge mirror from end to end of the room. Out of
nowhere, you recognize the haunting voice of the Immortal Goddess, Alanis,
and a shiver runs up your spine...

rooms.Name: MidKnight's Study
rooms.Description:
The first thing you notice as you arrive is the total darkness of
this room.  Well, not total darkness, as your eyes adjust you can
see a gentle light coming down from above.  You look up, expecting
to see a skylight, and instead see the sky.  Stars stretch out in
every direction for as far as the eye can see, and the moon shines
down, keeping watch over all the sleeping world.  As you look around
the walls and floor of this place appear out of the darkness, long
shadows trailing behind them.  On the walls are rows and rows of
well crafted, leather bound books, on all topics imaginable.  Comfy
yet formal chairs sit around a small table off to one side of the
room.  In the corner is MidKnight's computer desk, with a seven pointed
star hanging in the air over it.  MidKnight walks around his domicile,
not noticing the lack of light.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Looking at the star, it seems to glow and hum before your very eyes.
There is a snake coiled into the sign of infinity in the center, biting
it's own tail like the great serpent Uroborus.  The star seems at first
to be a normal six pointed star, but looking carefully you notice that
there are actually seven points.  As you move closer, you think you notice
movement out of the corner of your eye... did that snake move?

rooms.Name: Azuth's Tower
rooms.Description:
This room is the zenith of the brilliant column of pure energy which is
Azuth's Tower. Small arcs of electricity swirl from the walls to the floor
and celing of the chamber, as well as about the furniture and various shelves
which adorn the area. A faint but pleasant humming comes from all around, and
there is a hint of ozone in the air here. Easily the most distinguishing
feature of Azuth's abode is an immense sapphire table resting in the center
of the room, behind which sits a chair of obsidian. A large tome is lying
open on the table, collecting dust. The northeastern corner of the room
contains a curious shimmering curtain, much like you'd expect to find in a
bank vault...

Exits.Description:
Ah, you'd probably just hit your head against the wall as you attempted that
feat. Then again...

ExtraDescs.Description: Funny, they don't LOOK like pure energy.
Yes, but it ISN'T a bank vault.
Sapphire has two p's in it, dolt.

It appears to be a large spellbook. Right now it's open to a page entitled,
"Tashia's Ludicrous And Rediculous, Foolishly Ineluctable, And Yet Actually
Somewhat Useful And Amusing In A Few Random Situations Which Might Not
Involve Penguins, Incantation (Enchantment/Charm)". Hmm, must be powerful.

The obsidian chair isn't much more than a big block of obsidian cut into a
shape which is suitable to sit in.  It doesn't look very comfortable.
There's nothing special about the immense sapphire table.

You look very closely at the ozone. It looks like this:   + -
                                                        O=O-O
A small blue crackle of electricity appears momentarily, then vanishes.

The shelves are neatly lined with books, and the furniture is placed in such
a way to make it easy to reach almost any book without getting up.

Ah, you'd probably just hit your head against the wall as you attempted that
feat. Then again...
You don't see a Zenith 27 inch television here.

rooms.Name: Room of Pain
rooms.Description:
You are in a room filled with all types of mudder torture devices.  The
most prevalant one is a rack.  It is lined with spikes and has some leather 
wrist cuffs with more metal spikes lining the inside.  These are attached
to four cranks which look like they have been engineered to turn easily.
Among the other items in this room are various whips, hot pokers glowing in
the fire, and various enlongated knifes.  Truly a place no mudder wants to
be.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You see a beautifully crafted mahogony rack.  It's your standard rack
but it looks like the person who made it put loving time and effort
into each of the gold embossed carvings of bludgeoned mudders, 
pierced mudders, and just being plain tortured mudders into the varn-
ished unsanded rack.

rooms.Name: Frosty's Winter Wonderland
rooms.Description:
This place seems to be an endless expanse of snow-covered land. One could not
tell for sure however, because of the raging blizzard that eternally
encompasses these lands known as Snowville. The snow here is up to your
knees, and is beginning to numb out the lower portion of your legs from the
intense cold. Amidst all the snow however, stands a magnificent throne,
seemingly created, and elegantly fashioned of solid ice. This throne,
belonging to the god of winter, Frosty himself, is said to be so cold, that
if anyone beside he were to sit upon it, they would instantly be frozen into
a solid statue of ice, of which would be placed among the others in Frosty's
trophy room within his great Ice Palace.

rooms.Name: Starfall's sanctum
rooms.Description:
A small comfortable room. A warm bed in the corner, a scarred wooden desk and
comfortable chairs make this his home. Papers and books give this a well
lived in look. Only his closest friends are allowed here Here, he begins his
adventures into the world beyond

ExtraDescs.Description: Scarred and worn, Starfall treasures this desk once used by his father
Warm and cozy covered with a quilt given to him with love by his grandmother.

rooms.Name: The Studio
rooms.Description:
This is Sargon's favorite place, his space at the craft center.  Two large
tables define the north and south boundries.  On these tables are several
clay vessels in various stages of completion.  The concrete wall to the east
is covered with posters.  Against the wall is a desk full of clay tools and
ceramics books.  Next to the desk is a large garbage can of aging clay and
several recycle buckets.  The western border is a heavy shelving unit full
of completed ceramic wares.  In the center of the floor is a crappy Shimpo
throwing wheel.

rooms.Name: Sarnoth's Grove
rooms.Description:
All around you is a thick mist, but a warm fire keeps it away. Within it's
light it is warm and dry despite the weather. There are a few log benches
near the fire, and a bag of marshmallows and several perfect toasting sticks
rest near one of the benches. A little farther away, just close enough to
keep you comfortably warm all night, are several sleeping bags. A small
stream at the edge of the mist sparkles under the light of a crescent moon
and stars, which also shine on this place in any weather. The gurgling of the
stream, the crackle of the fire, and the rustle of the wind in the trees all
combine to lull you into total relaxation.

rooms.Name: Tindalos' Groove
rooms.Description:
The corners of time must, at one point, collide with one another.
This is the area where time is most vulnerable to the hounds... Yes, the
hounds that can smell your future and hunt your past, the hounds that
may destroy your mortality before you were mortal.
The hounds that control the past, the future, and the present all at once.

This is the room.  Built of obtuse angles that defy the laws of physics.
This is where the master of the corners of time will sit, will wait,
and will remember when the hounds shall come.  This is the empty
room of the present.  This is the convergence of the corners of time.

rooms.Name: Meribah's Bedroom Office.
rooms.Description:
His room appears well used, and some might say broken.  A large oak computer
desk rests in the center, and a matching book shelf is supported by the
southern wall.  A suit of lamellar with a barbute helmet peers at you from
the northeastern corner.  From the ceiling a Storvik tabard and Blackspear
household cross hang proudly. Armor and sewing materials litter the floor.

ExtraDescs.Description: It appears to be a celtic cross, and the silvery has blackened with tarnish.
The blue and white tabard is scarred with rips and bood stains.
You see a small label entitled "Bush."

It has been built well, and the blackened leather plates are very tight, with
white lacing holding them together.
Many military strategy, forensic science, and army books dominate the shelf.
The helmet has been made by the master armorer Johan Bleah.

rooms.Name: The Shattered Remains of Neo-Tokyo
rooms.Description:
You find yourself standing amongst piles of rubble and charred
corpses. You look all around only to see death, destruction and chaos.
There appears to have been some sort of holocaust, but god only knows
what could cause this much damage this quickly. You don't feel very
safe here..

rooms.Name: Eomer's Exotic Expanse
rooms.Description:
Imagine yourself in space  when suddenly you see a bright point of light.
That bright point then rushes outward forming a brilliant line in the vast
darkness of nothingness before you. The line grows thicker untill it
separates and forms a square floating about you, which in its turn grows
larger and separates into two, no, 6 squares, all forming a cube. This cube
then starts phasing in either time, or with another dimension, forming a
hypercube. This hypercube is where Eomer is, if you can concentrate enough,
you may see him.

rooms.Name: Seekers room..
rooms.Description: He will change this as soona s he get's time

ExtraDescs.Description:
Looking out the big picture window, you see a beautiful view.  Maeve's
window looks down a large, rolling hill.  The grass is green and snooth
yet, though it is obviously autumn.  The hill rolls down to a large
lake, sparkling and glistening in the afternoon sun.  There are many trees,
all of them covered with spectacular foliage of red and orange and yellow.
In the field beside the lake, you spy two deer.  Straining your eyes,
you can see that one sports a maginifcent rack, while the other, smaller
one, does not.  The deer stoop to drink from the lake, then turn and
wander together into the woods.  There is a slight breeze, which ruffles
the colored leaves and makes ripples on the water.  All in all, it is
a perfect day.

Listen, will you learn to hear me from afar?
It's a question of inclining the heart more than
the ear.
You'll find bridges in yourself, and roads
To reach all the way to me who waits and stares.

What does it matter, the Atlantic's width.
The fields, woods, mountains between us two?
One by one they'll have to give up on that day
You turn your eyes this way.

Jules Superville

I saw you take his kiss! "'Tis true."
O, modesty! "'Twas strictly kept:
He thought me asleep, at least I knew
He thought I thought he thought I slept."

Hanging on the wall you see a beautiful painting.  Titled 'The Storm'
and painted by French artist Pierre Auguste Cot, the painting shows two
figures, a young man and a young woman.  She is clad in a long, totally
transparent dress of pure white.  He is barechested, with short pants
clinging to his waist and a hunting horn hung at his side.  Both are
barefoot, and they hold his shirt above their heads to shield them
from the first droplets of rain.  They are running along a narrow path,
both peering behind them, over their shoulders, to get a glimpse at 
the storm which has runied their clandestine meeting.

rooms.Name: The graveyard of Lost Souls
rooms.Description:
This is a large graveyard with many different headstones. Each headstone
represents a different friend that kasmiur has left behind in the past. Some
many people so many different ideas and dreams along with them. Hopefully
there will be no more in the future and you will definatly not be one left in
the past but one that travels along in the future.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Kerstin and bartolo were the favorite clan bots that helped newbies along the
way.

This was the old leader of CYBERFORCE now long gone and no more. hopefully he
will be proud of what kas has done with the clan with kasmiur as the head
runner.

rooms.Name: Drazzst's Cave
rooms.Description:
This cave is rather neat.  There are a bunch of books sitting on a makeshift
bookshelf, carved into the stone of the cave wall by some industrious fellow.
There are two sets of cushions, arranged in such a way so that something
might sleep on them.  One o f them is a beautiful deep maroon.  The other is
a majestic purple.  There is a sign over the purple cushions.

Exits.Description: There is a dark hole here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The Sign reads: This is Gwyn's cushion.  DON'T EVEN THINK OF SLEEPING HERE OR
SHE'LL MESS YOU UP!!!

rooms.Name: Sonya's room
rooms.Description: This is Sonya's room.. she will change this once she has done olc.

rooms.Name: Shifter's Tower
rooms.Description:
The modern equivalent of the stereotypical wizard's tower, this place looks
like the best place for the magi-technically oriented. While one wall is lined
with ancient spellbooks, another contains rack upon rack of CD-ROM's,
containing Gigabytes of digitally stored spells. A really powerful-looking
enchanted laptop computer sits on a futuristic desk. The enspelled ethernet
link allows lag-free internet access 24/7. You could spend weeks in here
without ever getting bored.

rooms.Name: South-Eastern tower of Castle Zykos
rooms.Description:
A pleasant and well kept room at the top of the tower.  It overlooks the
grasslands to the south and west, and mountains to the east and north.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You see the purple-gray mountains of the planet Terraron.  No mortal has
ever gazed upon such a sight.

You see the grasslands of the planet Terraron.  A place no mortal has 
ever walked.

rooms.Name: Althor's Ancient Aes Sedai Platform
rooms.Description:
Fire bursts from every pore of your body, burning through your meak armor.
Even as you open your mouth to scream, a gateway opens right where you stood.
Bloody halves of your burning body fall to the ground.  Althor stands here
staring not into the blackness, but at a great columned hall with lion-carved
stone panels, where his eternal enemy sits upon a guiled throne.  Sending
fire and lightning ahead of him, Althor steps from his platform through the
gateway as it closes behind him.  He WAS death.

rooms.Name: Hysteria's Grid
rooms.Description:
There's nearly a foot of water on the floor in this room and the walls are
lined with antique air-break high-voltage switches.  In the corner stands a
huge transformer, which is humming at a teeth-rattling volume. CAUTION signs
are stuck on nearly everything in here.  The walls, ceiling, and floor are
constructed entirely of metal, as a grounding grid, due to the high levels of
static electricity.

rooms.Name: CC's Cave
rooms.Description:
You enter a large room carved from an underground cave that is filled with
computer screens. In the center of the room, you see a HUGE screen in the
center that has all sorts of operations. To the right you see a large car
thats all black... Wait a minute! Isnt that the Batmobile!

rooms.Name: HigherAnarchy's Castle of Chaos
rooms.Description:
As you step into the castle, all hell breaks loose. You feel your body
mutating into a state unlike anything you have ever experianced. After a few
moments of this chaotic state, you feel much better however, and owe it to
the tequila you drank last night.   Finally, after a long maze, you arrive at
the meeting room of HigherAnarchy. Taking up most of the room is a huge
marble table with big friendly letters on it saying, DON'T PANIC.  Huge
leather executive chairs cover all edges of the table.

rooms.Name: Wybaar's sanctuary
rooms.Description:
This room is a comfortable library.  You feel a little cool in here, but
that's how Wybaar wants it. There is a computer on the desk, it hums with
power.  Most of the titles on the shelves are mathematics texts. One in
particular catches your eye.  It is entitled "The Solution to Every
Mathematical Problem You Will Ever Encounter." You try to sneak a peek at the
book, but you can't read any of the writing inside.  Sorry :)

Exits.Description: This is a door to the Ice Box.
This is a door to the Lower Board Room of the Immortals.
This is a door to the Quest chamber.
This is a door to a quiet lounge for off-duty construction crew.
This door leads to the area near the Temple altar.
This door leads to the Temple of Midgaard.

rooms.Name: Rigbyd's Habitat
rooms.Description:
You stand in the middle of a gross looking apartment room. Clothes are strewn
about the floor, and you can see empty pizza boxes cluttering what isnt
covered by the clothes. In the background a stereo is blaring Korn at full
volume. In the middle of the room is a TV set which looks unused, in front of
it a beat up couch. The whole highlight of the room is the corner where an
awsome looking computer sits. It almost looks like who ever got this thing
must have stole it from NASA or a military agency. CD's and disks are lying
about all over in that corner and the one desk is covered with manuals and
help books. Through the dim light, in front of the computer so see someone
bent over pounding away at the keys furiously. You wonder who it is.....
